document.title: Maryland College and Career Ready Standards for English Language Arts Grades PreK - K

6FB772AC90E84769AA41473630DA8E73.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, being
read to, and responding to texts.

1DF50304F22A44A38CDE7382B3ED6BC8.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use
(e.g., note objects in the classroom that are small).

1E2C92CB4DE34F7EBD2BFFF8B7269B0C.description:
With modeling and support, demonstrate understanding of
frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their
opposites (antonyms).

26B8E8B5F9C944CE96828E4D5A6EC555.description:
With modeling and support, sort common objects into
categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the
categories represent.

E28AE6D571B5411699F71361ED0B50C5.description:
With modeling and support from adults, explore word
relationships and nuances in word meanings.

9DF11DAF58E241368C3F6088C56B138E.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases
based on pre-kindergarten reading and content.

A66E125609EB4C5384DBE85F06CD8935.description:
Develop fine motor skills necessary to control and sustain
handwriting.

53534DF618E34B4B94678F099C73D38F.description:
Use letter-like shapes, symbols, letters, and words to
convey meaning.

996871C46B27471B9554A99C77F1070F.description:
Demonstrate awareness of name and function of end
punctuation (e.g., period, question mark, exclamation point).

F83C1CA3AEB54C27A890200666F5FC84.description: Recognize that their name begins with a capital letter.

EA7EFC9C02084BE392FD11DA4C0655A1.description:
Gain exposure to conventions of standard English
capitalization, punctuation, and spelling during shared reading and
writing experiences.

624BBE7A73F846959599F6ACDA958343.description: Produce complete sentences in shared language activities.

718063E1858647E69EBC923C7E37DA2F.description:
Gain exposure to the most frequently occurring
prepositions (e.g. to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

71CAD881B85E42FBA86CA6924AB08697.description:
Understand and begin to use question words (e.g.,
interrogatives who, what, where, when, why, how).

A9463DD54E96443F858C38F862DF0756.description:
Develop understanding of singular and plural nouns (e.g.,
dog means one dog; dogs means more than one).

63409E3A072B4662B06441D0F0DE855A.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

216F309365574BD28B51BF75A9948009.description: Print upper- and lowercase letters in first name.

52873AC449754A1A820634B4D8959A84.description:
Demonstrate beginning understanding of the conventions of
standard English grammar and usage when engaged in literacy activities.

5B817C349D004C01AE83937163A6E8EA.description:
With modeling and support, speak audibly and express thoughts,
feelings, and ideas clearly.

08598E84BE8647DCBE9B8C3C18CAA57C.description:
Add drawings or visual displays to descriptions as desired to
provide additional detail.

83E9933E8FDD42629C91F6A37A4D3927.description:
Describe familiar people, places, things, and events with
modeling and support.

094365F588B04B779D900A9F1605BFD7.description:
Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information,
or clarify something that is not understood.

FC734BC2DD46415A8B358BC7E719716F.description:
Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information
presented orally or through other media by asking and answering
questions about key details with modeling and support.

49EC05AF4B0E48ADB4E63EEFC45BE240.description:
During scaffolded conversations, continue a conversation
through multiple exchanges.

716D87104D4B4F59A4238953A0A1D1E7.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to
others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under
discussion).

16BCC8C89E1B4380B655FD4625E4CEBE.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners
about pre-kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small
and larger groups.

FEB5A6B3A9BB469A87B8BF956FE2ED32.description:
With modeling and support from adults, recall information from
experiences or information from provided sources to answer a question.

1A82F70605AC43AD8BD33F366B124F95.description: Participate in shared research and shared writing projects.

A1E5065A4838425D9A8DF3E8A98582FC.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

3FDAE172ED71429C857B898387662872.description:
With prompting and support from adults, explore a variety of
digital tools to express ideas.

E70AC0F596B3474784ABC174EF9CCCBA.description:
With modeling, guidance, and support from adults, review
drawing, dictation, or developmentally appropriate writing.

3A1E17952EBC460FA69C71D104A9531F.description:
With modeling and support, use a combination of drawing,
dictating, or developmentally appropriate writing to communicate a
personal story about a single event and tell about the event in a
meaningful sequence.

0A95C281BCCE481989DFFB86CF2014B5.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, or developmentally
appropriate writing to state information on a topic.

027DD306E2A34BCC8AAFDD1FEF97BBC2.description:
With modeling and support, use a combination of drawing,
dictating, and developmentally appropriate writing to share opinion
about an experience or book.

54EE94881640442D9A774EA6671EB1D9.description:
Engage with a variety of texts (e.g., a variety of
structures and/ or genres) with purpose and understanding.

BE40BFEBE03946F58A96E3231C69F23B.description:
Recognize name in print as well as some environmental
print (symbols/words).

B81F7CC5C7FD489EA18A9D03A467DF86.description:
Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter sound
correspondences by producing the most frequent sound for some
consonants.

745BA06D674A46438CA2D1CD317670E4.description:
Recognize that words are made up of letters and their
sounds.

D5A8DDE884534FF0A0A931CD48F00EA5.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in
decoding words.

54A35E04663C4016BF119321CD8454CF.description: Orally blend and segment individual phonemes in twoto-three phoneme words.

61D2FE35536246C39CC8F6824A6012C5.description:
Isolate and pronounce the initial sound in spoken
words.

54E633B75B2D482293ED56311B7685BE.description:
Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable
spoken words.

CF4C9FABADF844689D12BA59BEF3C4A2.description:
Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in
spoken words.

C0B379AF76AA4E7693119D575FBEA38D.description:
Identify and isolate individual words in a spoken
sentence.

5AB5FDBD885A493485BBD0DB2DCD84DC.description: Recognize rhyming words in spoken language.

990157D94C004C3987A70894C97B51F9.description:
Demonstrate understanding of spoken words and sounds
(phonemes).

CB2DFBEE358240C0AED233936804CD31.description:
Recognize and name some upper- and lowercase letters
of the alphabet.

0C4B129ABADF447092FAEB8B11AB8894.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

A0D2DCF2D6C64A9CAA61034311BE57C3.description: RF.PK.1.b Recognize that spoken words can be written and read.

9C171306F9D64DBAAF7A53A0B20A67B1.description:
Demonstrate an awareness that words are read from left
to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

4B6756005AA2472EBEE47C9ADB180F98.description: Demonstrate understanding of basic features of print.

BE73A66014B0439EBE157273673FB7AE.description:
Actively engage in-group reading activities with purpose and
understanding.

5700F93A9B37447DAB057A4086BB1FCF.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

69C59C001FD94D11BCB92F874E6DF0CC.description:
With prompting and support, discuss similarities and differences
between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations or
descriptions).

E81FD9D9CD094F52BE449484406E5D4F.description:
With modeling and support, identify the reasons an author gives
to support points in a text.

A6004DC6DF204C9C8951A27D1E28DF4D.description:
With modeling and support, tell how the illustrations/
photographs support the text.

CF83763A4D6842ED915EA05E1D5FA0A7.description:
With modeling and support, define the role of the author and
illustrator/photographer in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

0AF8F4EC1BD34E829783D5BD377F385F.description:
With modeling and support, identify the front cover and back
cover of a book.

A773F408501849E3842C83554F0D3400.description:
With modeling and support, answer questions about unknown
words in a text.

47366916938A48DCBCD42F0F2F5BD4AC.description:
With modeling and support, connect individuals, events, and
pieces of information in text to life experiences.

2AAB0745A107479F9584C9D9938E58B1.description:
With modeling and support, recall one or more detail(s) related
to the main topic from an informational text.

17A39AE23C8A4E23B040A4ADCEAD297C.description:
With modeling and support, answer questions about details in an
informational text.

8A654F6D944841EC9642E1FABAD262CA.description:
Actively engage in-group reading activities with purpose and
understanding.

1F1C8371E07745B79F4C852B4D45C5FD.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

E046138CF063448EACE4505F4BF7D7B2.description:
With modeling and support, compare adventures and
experiences of characters in familiar stories.

3CCDEBE9E32F4366A1C6C96D30BE6BB2.description:
With modeling and support, tell how the illustrations support
the story.

00F204E42DE0462DBE8192F7EC018A2D.description:
With modeling and support, identify the role of author and
illustrator.

C13FEF37F6184475A57BA9251EF48B06.description:
Gain exposure to common types of literary texts (e.g.,
storybooks, poems).

ECFBDBDC52034A12B76DC7933CD7642E.description:
With modeling and support, answer questions about unknown
words in stories and poems.

3D136BB60BC94E22BD881B5427F51725.description:
With modeling and support, identify characters, settings, and
major events in a story.

07E25169F12143EFAB4B570F6699DCCB.description: With modeling and support, retell familiar stories/poems.

D9C6CCFBFAF148D1B36DA091E8333C1E.description:
With modeling and support, answer questions about details in a
text.
